data.text: Is the Deda Handlebar Tape Good?
The regular cork? In my experience, no. I'd go with Zipp CX before that, but the best overall is Supacaz Kush IMO
data.author: Josh Kebschull

data.text: I 2nd this â€˜
data.author: Patrick Lynch

data.text: I have used it without problems.
data.author: Curtis Johnson

data.text: but I don't want to waste money if it's shit, that's why I'm asking ðŸ™„
data.author: Carl Llewellyn

data.text: I used the deda cork tape for years. It was very cheap so I could replace it every few months to keep it looking good. I thought it was very comfortable
data.author: Fraser Kynaston

data.text: it's very cheap and very subjective. I could say it's the best tape on the market but you might try it and disagree. And vice-versa. So just try it, or don't.
data.author: Steve Eldridge

data.text: I like their Mistral tape, it's a lot like classic thin fizik tape
data.author: Braden Graham

data.text: its fine for what you pay. I use it a lot as I can't really justify 40,60,80 bucks for tape that basically does the same thing. Best bet is to go to the big online retailers and see what's on special. They put big discounts on 'last years' colors.
data.author: Chris Summers

data.text: why the idiot replies.. the reason I'm asking is so I don't need to waste money.. ffs....
data.author: Carl Llewellyn

data.text: heya Carl, thanks for the thoughtful note. My point was that $16 is pretty cheap, and you would then know, first hand, exactly how good that tape is. If you just threw that post out there to find FB punching bags, you might not make it to my Christmas list. Anyway, you seem pretty mad. I hope your shit life gets better than not being able to cough up chump change for a necessity. Maybe a bike ride would help?
data.author: Greg Johnson

data.text: No, only by the Silca Nastro Piloti. Best tape made with the same low hysteresis rubber Nike uses for their fastest running shoes, 3M adhesives, best quality finishing tape with 3M adhesive.
data.author: Mark Jake Jacobson
